Posts.Content: Hi, thanks for your reply, temp seems okay but my chest is a but ruttly, decided not to wait, seeing GP later on today, hopefully get some meds...
Posts.Title: Chest infection or just a cough?

Posts.Content: Good afternoon everyone,  I finished my chemotherapy last Thursday, thought I was maybe coming down with a cold, chest was a bit tight and a small cough, chemo went ahead anyway and I was told okay to take paracetamol up until this coming Thursday, just finished steroids last night but my chest is still not right and I have a phlegmy cough. I'm trying to hang on until tomorrow to see how I feel, may then ring GP, don't want to end up in hospital especially as I have my radiotherapy planning appointment on Friday, do you think I'm okay to wait until then?
Posts.Title: Chest infection or just a cough?

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy Going to see GP later, don't want risk any longer.Thanks for your reply.. Xx
Posts.Title: Chest infection or just a cough?

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat45 I've not filled my profile in yet (didn't really know about it). I'm not on any hormonal therapy or bisphonsphonates just yet,, I see my oncologist Tuesday next week for those starting I think, gosh what a time you had,! I hope I don't go down that road. Thanks for your reply.. Best wishes xx
Posts.Title: Chest infection or just a cough?

Posts.Content: All is well, spent six and a half hours on the oncology ward yesterday, felt really rough and temp was spiking but bloods were okay,they're happy for me to continue with the antibiotics my gp gave me, but if course if I start to feel worse.....I will have to return,have to say I am feeling a bit better this morning, phew...
Posts.Title: Chest infection or just a cough?

Posts.Content: Been to the docs, been given a seven day supply of 500mg clarithromycin, let's hope these shift it!
